newsitem.title: GERMANY: German DTB launches dlr-mark currency option trade.
newsitem.headline: German DTB launches dlr-mark currency option trade.

text.p: Currency options debuted on Germany's electronic futures and options exchange, DTB, on Monday with exchange officials calling the newly launched product a success, half-way through the first trading session.
DTB began trading dollar-mark currency options, the first such instrument traded in Germany, on Monday after announcing the launch last year.

"By mid-afternoon, we had traded 5,600 contracts and we are quite satisfied," said bourse spokesman Stefan Lutz, adding that the bourse expected the day's total traded contracts to be between 10,000 and 20,000.
The result was particularly impressive considering U.S. markets were largely closed in observance of Martin Luther King Day, Lutz said.
While the exchange had not yet decided whether to launch other options, Lutz said the success of this instrument may prompt exchange officials to make other options available for trading.
